transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (slurps coffee) Who's on the show tonight?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's your show, don't you know?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, he used to be on "CHiPs".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I thought you said he was on "CHiPs".

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sips soda) Well, yeah, he used to sing... on "CHiPs".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yes, a "CHiPs" singer. Very famous! Verrrry talented.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not familiar with his work, but he must be all the rage if he's on my show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in to set) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost! My guest tonight, singer, songwriter, Jonathan Richman! Please, if you will, say "how do you do" to my band, Zorak and the Original Way Outs. (Way Outs play Space Ghost to the desk) Zorak, what songs did this guy sing for "CHiPs"?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Um, uh, "Motorcycle Arresting Cops", uh, numbers 12 and 35, I think.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: It's, uh, it certainly is, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (taps cards) Uh, Moltar, what was that?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, uh, sorry. Uh, I was daydreaming.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jonathan, are you getting enough oxygen?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's talk about your new album. And tell me about your striped shirts.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) And that is your answer?...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay! Who are your musical influences?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: I think, well, that was the first thing I thought of, but I think it's too late now. You know, remember that double question you asked the first time?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: That confused me, so now I'm thinking differently.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmmm, uh, want me to do it again?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I liked it the first way.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alright. Ahem! Who do think is a bad influence?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: You mean on me, or on the world in general?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Either. Iither. Oh, let's call the whole thing off. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Well, see, I don't know if there's such a thing as a bad influence, I think... it's up to you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about a bad influence on the world?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Well, I don't know if there's a bad influence on them either. It's up to them.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What about a bad influence on a proper diet?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but then, what's a proper diet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Question 6, do you have any arch-enemies?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak and Moltar are my arch-enemies. Zorak's the green one over there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're a musician, sing for us.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: (strums weird chord on guitar) But I gotta do it in the key of X. (strums strange chords and sings monotone)Hey there, little insect,Don't scare him so,Don't land on him, buddy,And bite him, though.Hey there, little insect,Please calm down,So he can have fun,And fool around.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: And don't think I don't appreciate it, thank you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you think of keyboard players, aren't they repulsive?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: I admire keyboard players, 'cause I don't know how to do it myself.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, but "probably" isn't the same thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (reading cue cards) If your... If "your"? (boy, here's some good punctuation!) If your were evil, what kind of evil would you get into? I'm just gonna read it as is, if you don't mind.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's an excellent question. I think, uh, I'd get into something that tasted good. If something's gonna be evil, it might as well taste good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then, let's see here... hmmm... Oh, what are your super-powers?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Well, there's (strums strings below lower guitar bridge) Then, of course, there's (strum strings above upper bridge)

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: But I only have two super-powers, though.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Please tell me about your super-powers!

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I might, but it might be a secret.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (flies out of his chair) You can't fly.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (returns to his chair, stretches and yawns) Moltar, is it time for a break yet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, let's take a break!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) (to himself) My brain is vaporizing. (normal voice) Hey, Zorak, why don't you do a song for everybody?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're messin' with me again, aren't you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. (blasts him with destructo ray) This would be a gooood place for a break.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Okay, then, let's see here... Jonathan, who is your favorite talk show host?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, that would preclude the follow-up question of least favorite.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, then, let's see here... What is your...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: On the show tonight, the always exciting Jonathan Richman. Jonathan, do you get sick of people reading your mind without asking?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: No, sometimes I want to see if they can do it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (tries to read Jonathan's mind, with Morse code "CQ" repeating in background)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. When you record, what do you like to eat?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no, that's not it, try again.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Jonathan, play another song for us.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (while Jonathan plays) Moltar, is the show over yet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What do you say we end it here?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: (still playing) There's the summer wind part.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dan Fogelberg write that one for ya?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really. You're, you're not jerking my chain, are you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you use a tire-sa-, tyrannasaur-, t-, the-, tesaurus, the-, thesaurus?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It all comes out of your head?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, they just come to me.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: (sings and plays)Well, there's a dumpster in front of my room,And the neon sign doesn't work too well,It hasn't worked so well since World War II,It's another lonely night in a cheap motel.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'll bet you've slept a lot on couches.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did you ever find money in the cushions?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: It's, uh, it certainly is, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay. Ummm, have you ever been abducted by an alien craft?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, wanna come fishing with us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm. Tell us a good fish story.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Well, I was in Barcelona one time, and the people who put on the show, took us to this restaurant, right there on the beach. They gave us all these dishes with saffron rice, and all different kinds of fish. Tasted good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, let me ask you this. What do you do on your, um, trampoline?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can you do a backwards flip?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Front flip, but my front flip isn't too good, either.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Very distinguished looking, I must say.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: I had one, I had a pig mask for a while.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Are you hiding anything from us?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, who is that you're talking to?

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: (almost in unison) Charlemagne. Ah, timing problem!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clears his throat) Just clearin' the pipes. Okay! Hmmm... Would you smack Bob Dylan around if you had to?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um, give me some advice on entertaining audiences.

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: Have fun with them. Delight in them.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay then. Let's see here... Oh, um, tell us something you've only said one time, like, "More leeches, please!"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh... before you go, give us your words of wisdom.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was in the hospital once...

transcript.speaker: Jonathan Richman
transcript.dialogue: And don't think I don't appreciate it.
